definition: difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student

sentences.english: Putin describes his younger self as a poor student and a "hooligan."
sentences.chinese: 普京把少年时的自己形容成差生。

sentences.english: No matter how, you will come across the poor students.
sentences.chinese: 无论如何，你都会遇到“差生”。

sentences.english: It didn't take the new teacher long to separate . the sheep from the goat .
sentences.chinese: 新来的老师没多久就把好生和差生区别开来了。

sentences.english: I wouldn't say he was a bad student.
And my topic is about how poor students learn English.
sentences.chinese: 现在，我想要谈论的主题是关于差生学英语。

definition: teacher in charge of a class
abbr. for mathematics 數學|数学[shu4 xue2], physics 物理[wu4 li3] and chemistry 化學|化学[hua4 xue2]
to study at the same school/fellow student/classmate/CL:位[wei4],個|个[ge4]
literature and language/(PRC) Chinese (as a school subject)
to overemphasize some topic (at the expense of others)/overdoing it/to go overboard
